page.title: 01West Worldham Features
page.content: The main geographical features of this area are gently rolling hills used as farmland and grazing. Squares 4,8,12 include exampes of Hampshire Beech Hangers, and the terrain is rougher,steeper and more wooded. The farm houses an churches are generally old, 17c - 19c. One small pond square 7 used for fishing. In winter, foxhunt and pheasant shooots. Only one main road, squares 1,2,4,10 carrying public transport. Other roads are less than 4m wide or farm tracks. Several sunken lanes, Hartley Manditt sq 7 is deserted village, now featuring only a small church used occasionally. There are two major power lines of pylons, squares 1,2,5,6,9. There is now beginning interest from oil companies, with 1 projected exploratory well, square 2. there is one village hall, square 7. A sparsely populated rural
